p.note: For a system upgrade do NOT clear the label before starting the upgrade.

body.p: This topic describes how to check whether a device has a label on a partition.

section.p:
To check whether a device has label on a partition, perform the following step:
Log on to the node and use the parted command: sudo parted -lThe output lists all of the block devices. Following is an example output for /dev/sdc with a single partition and a label of c0a8f502h000. Because the partition has a label, if you are about to install and deploy the system, you must clear this label before starting the deployment. As part of the deployment process, the system will label the partition.. . . Model: QEMU QEMU HARDDISK (scsi) Disk /dev/sdc: 20.0GB Sector size (logical/physical): 512B/512B Partition Table: gpt Disk Flags:
Number Start End Size File system Name Flags 1 1049kB 20.0GB 20.0GB xfs c0a8f502h000
. . .
